data.title: Feature/default path preference
data.body:
Closes #1324.

I might refactor this to pass a `filesystem` to `PreferencesFormat` from `Preferences` rather than obtaining a new reference.  But this certainly works.

data.title: [Editor] Unable to save a new directory as the default location for new projects.
data.body:
Hello Everyone, 

Well, every time I try to do a new project, and I change the default directory and then do a new project, it doesn't saves the previous location I have used, there is no "Settings" or "Preferences" menu in the editor, although there is a "Clear Preferences" option in the "Developers" menu.

Any help is deeply appreciated, and if there is an actual option to do what I'm looking for, Excuse me for my "newbieness" I'm just relatively new to this Atomic Game Engine thing!

Reference: https://github.com/AtomicGameEngine/AtomicGameEngine/blob/9ff7136b36f1acd25479400404b947d6446b208b/Script/AtomicEditor/ui/modal/CreateProject.ts#L61-L71 (Many thanks to github.com/rosshadden)

data.title: Make require search node_modules
data.body:
The `require()` function needs to search in node_modules, and look at directories, and their package.json files (so that require can reference packages by directory name).

Basically, this is for npm support.

We should probably generate a package.json file, but I don't think that we need to care what it says in the root directory, it's only their for `npm install --save <package_name>` behavior. We might have to search down the rabbit hole of node_modules since each package may contain other packages.

data.title: Linux build image
data.body:
Feature request:

VM image (VMWare images convert with most other VM managers, I think) to be available on the Atomic Game Engine download page (or an "extras" section or page linked from that page) that can build:

- Linux Editor
- Linux Player
- Android Player
- Emscripten Player

This will significantly simplify the "hard to setup correctly" build environments, and it will also help C++ contributors test builds before hitting Travis CI blocks on PRs.

data.title: [Profiling] Add support for better instance type tracking for JS and C#
data.body:
The Context should hold the current "state" for native, JS, and C# which is then recorded in the RefCounted constructor.  This will clean up some instance type bookkeeping and be more accurate as well.

There needs to be a ATOMIC_METRICS_FULL definition added to the build with compile in support on the Context for current instantiation state for JS, C#, and Native.  

This involves setting and clearing a new Context state variable for every generated method (and major script entry points form native code).  Thus the optional preprocessor definition.

data.title: Scene view 3 d middle mouse move
data.body: use the same funcionality as the Q,E,A,D Keys to move the camera.

data.title: Subject Name support for EV code signing
[JS/TS] Add a core engine JavaScript extension system
data.body:
It would be good to be able to extend the core engine API with JavaScript (in addition to the native API exposed by duktape).  This will allow us more flexibility and extend classes/marshalling like we currently can do in C#.  Core engine extensions should (at least initially) be in pure JS with TypeScript ambient declarations.

JS class prototypes are challenging to layout using custom duktape stack manipulation, though hotspot methods can still be dropped native code with this strategy. 

The source for the core engine extensions in JS will reside in a subfolder in CoreData and be available to all applications.  The core engine JS extension import mechanism should initialize with the rest of the JS system and be fault tolerant if the source files are missing.

A motivation on this feature is to have math classes like Vector2/Vector3/Quat that are consistent with the C++ and C# API's instead of adding modules like gl-matrix to projects. (Math classes in JS are represented as number arrays and this remains an important performance/marshalling consideration when considering how to factor in more common X/Y/Z/W properties)

data.title: Fixed all occurrences of `typscript` typo, and reverted #1309.
data.body: Reverted #1309 for the reasons explained [here](https://github.com/AtomicGameEngine/AtomicGameEngine/pull/1309#issuecomment-270283241).  Also fixed all of the places `typescript` was incorrectly spelled `typscript`, including in the filename of the language extension file.

data.title: Restore Player.GetCurrentScene
[Physics] Add scripting support for missing cast methods

milestone.title: Issue Staging
milestone.description: A staging area for milestones, while we work through the backlog

data.body:
The physics scripting API is missing various casting methods due to PhysicsRaycastResult not being available to scripting.  PhysicsRaycastResult needs to inherit from RefCounted and be added to the physics package.  

Additionally, the Ray class needs to be added.  This should not extend RefCounted and instead use a blittable struct C# side (which we already have in the AtomicNET math module). It should use a custom JS type (defined in duktape API) for JS/TS side.  *This could be an opportunity to add "raw" classes to JSBind*, which would be used in bindings though with no (or little) generated implementation details.  Raw classes may need to have some limitations like not being able to have RefCounted/Object properties (so only primitive types)

Once this is done, most of this API should be available:

https://github.com/AtomicGameEngine/AtomicGameEngine/blob/498e42fcc2ec8f6dbc1a3a78ea0345c1d3931b0d/Source/Atomic/Physics/PhysicsWorld.h#L191

data.title: AtomicEditor setting CollisionShape does not update

milestone.title: Issue Staging
milestone.description: A staging area for milestones, while we work through the backlog

data.body: After making a RigidBody for a model, creating CollisionShape does not update in the editor when you change values in the inspector for ShapeType, Size. You have to close and reopen the project to see the results of the changed settings. Though once they are set, Offset Position does work interactively.

data.title: Expose PackageFile to scripting
data.body:
This PR exposes the PackageFile object so the scripting languages can load and unload them, and examine the contents. 
I had to create a new accessor, PackageFile::GetEntryName(unsigned) because the existing PackageFile::GetEntryNames() did not want to be bound.

data.title: Object Metrics/Tracking
data.body:
This PR adds a new Metrics subsystem capable of (deep) tracking engine and user RefCounted/Object instances including whether they were instantiated C++, C#, or JavaScript/TypeScript.  The metrics system will be expanded to track resource and other memory usage in the future.  

More information on the new object tracking the wiki page: https://github.com/AtomicGameEngine/AtomicGameEngine/wiki/Profiling

The PR adds lightweight RTTI to RefCounted (```const String& GetTypeName()```)  and punches up the Player subsystem with additional methods for loading, setting, unloading scenes. 

![profilemetrics](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/376203/21597298/6544694a-d0fd-11e6-8e86-76f1a9f44027.jpg)

data.title: [Feature Request]ProBuilder/CSG-style level building
data.body:
I think it would be an useful thing to have. I'm considering moving away from Unity, because with former EA boss as Unity's CEO (the very same one that was responsible for EA's mobile deviation and Dungeon Keeper Mobile), I don't think Unity's business model will be much ethical in the future. Frankly, I expect everything worst.

So I'm looking for worthy alternatives, and I must say that with C# support and virtually the same feature set, Atomic Engine is certainly among my options. Having Pro Builder/CSG-style level building would certainly make it even more attractive for me, since in many cases when you can create and manipulate geometry directly in the editor, 3D modeling software would only needed to be used to do either entities or more detailed versions of parts of the environment such as houses if needed. For indie projects, CSG is often what you only need since art budgets in indie teams are so low that we could as well build maps with CSG - would be easier and result would be about the same.

data.body: This makes typescript only scan the relevant directories, which should make it faster to build.

data.title: 2D designer related questions
data.body:
Hi!

I started to play with Atomic and created a simple 2D test application with typescript. It is just two scene: the first is a simple menu, the second is a blue rectangle with some bouncing balls. It works, but I have some issues and questions.

I created the blue rectangle with the following way: I put four StaticSprite2D (64x64 blue png picture)  and resized/moved to the left, right, top, bottom edge of the designer window. 
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7508341/21580939/cad3838e-d019-11e6-8301-5c5e91494216.png)

It looks good, but when I tried to run the code, I have got a following result:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7508341/21580945/0d69dec8-d01a-11e6-9afd-922b86565f01.png)

The another problem, that I don't know how to move the scene vertically and horizontally. I can use Ctrl+Right mouse, or Ctrl+mouse wheel combo, but these are 3D movements and not too useable in 2D design. Is there any way to do this ? I also didn't found how to reset the scene cam roatation/position: I can do it only with editing of the scene.asset.

data.title: Button URLs, updates to help menu/welcome/new build, TurboBadger font calculation tweaks
[JavaScript/TypeScript] Add native module enum objects
data.body:
As a follow up to #1304, the JS and TS API's should have identical enum value resolution.  This requires populating native module enum objects with values that mirror what is currently generated for TypeScript.

On the TypeScript side, ambient declarations for enum values should then be used which reference the JS API enum properties for consistency (including value) 

Important:  The existing JS API enum values should remain intact, though we do need to find a way to deprecate them.

data.title: Convert to TS style enums
data.body: This adds in TS style enums for all of the enumerated types.  It also retains the original JS style constants, but comments them to indicate that they should only be used with vanilla JS.  The Editor code has been updated to take advantage of the TS style enums everywhere.

data.title: Quick fix for #1301 - TS generated inspector fields blocks
data.body: TS now generates the inspector field blocks as ```_this.inspectorFields``` instead of ```this.inspectorFields```.  This looks for this additional pattern when trying to find inspector fields.

data.title: [CI, macOS] - Sporadic TypeScript compiler file access issue breaks builds
data.body:
There is an issue on the Mac Pro CI box with the typscript compiler, possibly a parallel build issue related to: https://github.com/Microsoft/TypeScript/issues/10909

```
error TS5033: Could not write file 'Data/AtomicEditor/CodeEditor/source/editorCore/clientExtensions/languageExtensions/typescript/workerprocess/workerProcessTypes.js.map': EEXIST: file already exists, mkdir 
```

data.title: [UI] TBEditField recreates embedded widgets when doing layout
data.body:
tb_style_edit calls CreateFragmentContent here on layout:

https://github.com/AtomicGameEngine/AtomicGameEngine/blob/master/Source/ThirdParty/TurboBadger/tb_style_edit.cpp#L936

Which creates embedded widgets whenever there is a layout, resize, etc:

https://github.com/AtomicGameEngine/AtomicGameEngine/blob/master/Source/ThirdParty/TurboBadger/tb_editfield.cpp#L670

So for example an embedded Button would be recreated: ```<widget TBButton: id: 'mybutton' text: 'Click Me'>```

This can get quite expensive and could be why the about dialog is slow on resize, the widgets should only be recreated if necessary, probably cached and then clear widget cache if content changes.
